intro: Mammillaria robustispina, commonly known as the robust spine cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a thick, ribbed stem that develops a pronounced spine tuft at the top. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its spines are typically white to gray in color and are relatively long and robust. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
